Article Title: Chiefs risk controversy with "greenest green flag" Travis Kelce as mother Donna Kelce drops major Taylor Swift hint in latest post
Article Text:
(Image via Imagn Images)

Read More

The Kansas City Chiefs have Travis Kelce back for the 2025-26 season, but his days as the team's top tight end might be numbered.Kelce returns to the Chiefs at age 35, clearly past his prime years. He's a franchise legend, racking up 12,151 receiving yards over 174 regular season games. But his numbers have steadily declined since 2022, the last season he crossed 1,000 receiving yards.Last season, Kelce caught 97 passes on 133 targets, but managed just three touchdowns—his career-low. It's reassuring to see Kelce on the field again, but the Chiefs should strongly consider increasing Noah Gray 's snaps.Noah Gray, drafted in the fifth round by the Chiefs in 2021, keeps improving. Last season was Gray's best yet, posting career-highs with 437 receiving yards and five touchdowns from 40 catches on 49 targets.At age 26, Gray is entering his prime years. Keeping him limited behind a declining Kelce could be a serious mistake. Kansas City recognized Gray’s potential with a contract extension, clearly seeing his value beyond a typical fifth-round pick.Pro Football Focus graded Gray at 74.2 last season, placing him eighth among all tight ends. Kelce's grade was 70.9, ranking him 15th. Gray objectively outperformed Kelce, suggesting it's time for Kansas City to prioritize youth over legacy.Taylor Swift dominated the recent iHeartRadio Music Awards , earning nine awards, including Artist of the Year, Pop Artist of the Year, and a special honor for her global "Eras Tour," plus six fan-voted categories.Though Swift missed the event at the Dolby Theater in LA, she sent a recorded acceptance speech. Fans speculated her boyfriend, Chiefs star Travis Kelce, filmed the video, citing what appeared to be his reflection in Swift's trophy.While that theory remains uncertain, Donna Kelce, Travis' mother, made her support clear. Mama Kelce proudly posted Swift’s awards haul on Instagram, gathering over 85,000 likes and enthusiastic reactions from fans.a fan another.Donna Kelce has formed a close bond with Swift since she started dating Travis in the summer of 2023, often sitting together at Chiefs games at Arrowhead Stadium. Mama Kelce also openly supports her other daughter-in-law, Kylie Kelce—wife of former NFL player Jason Kelce—recently comforting the couple following the loss of their dog.Swifties have always looked out for Taylor, especially when it comes to her relationships. Her love life’s been picked apart for years, and fans have stayed cautious—especially about how her partners’ families treated her. That’s why Donna’s warm, genuine support stands out. It feels like Taylor’s finally with someone whose family truly values and embraces her.
Article Summary: Travis Kelce returns to the Chiefs at age 35, clearly past his prime years. Noah Gray, drafted in the fifth round by the Chiefs in 2021, keeps improving. Gray objectively outperformed Kelce, suggesting it's time for Kansas City to prioritize youth.

Article Title: "I thought he’s gone": Dwayne Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union opens up about fearing the worst when the NBA legend was diagnosed with cancer
Article Text:
Image via Rich Fury/Getty Images

Dwayne Wade’s wife, Gabrielle Union, reveals she thought of the worst outcome when the NBA legend was diagnosed with cancer



Gabrielle Union Breaks Silence on Dwyane Wade’s Cancer Fight

Dwayne Wade has been considered as one of the most talented players in the NBA. The NBA legend is a world champion and has achieved a lot of success in his life, but everything came to a standstill in 2023. After a year, Dwayne Wade opened up about his struggles and the difficult days he had to go through while he fought a tough battle against cancer.A few weeks ago, Dwayne Wade opened up about his journey on his podcast, the WY Network,where he revealed that he decided to go for a health checkup normally and ended up with an inconclusive diagnosis.It was only on the recommendation of a third doctor that the NBA legend decided to undergo surgery and remove a significant portion of one of his kidneys. But Dwayne Wade’s battle did not end there.The NBA legend revealed that he faced difficulties in opening up to his family. He said, “My own journey to have that surgery, I think it was the first time that my family, my dad, my kids, they saw me weak. That moment was probably the weakest point I’ve ever felt in my life.”A few days later, his wife, popular actress, Gabrielle Union, appeared on The View and spoke about the emotional toll their family went through.Gabrielle Union said, "You hear cancer, you're paralyzed because you think of the absolute worst-case scenario. I've had so many friends who are cancer survivors. I didn't go there; I went to 'he's gone.' "Gabrielle Union also added that Dwayne Wade did not even speak to his family about the struggle he was going through.Fortunately, things worked out well for the NBA legend. While he had to remove a major portion of his kidney, it apparently tested positive for Stage 1 cancer.Currently, Dwayne Wade is absolutely healthy and is spreading awareness among his fans about his diagnosis and treatment. His wife, Gabrielle Union, spoke to Access Hollywood last month and reiterated how proud she is of her husband for doing this.Fans have also been very appreciative of Dwayne Wade spreading awareness among his audience, as many are now relieved that he is healthy. The NBA legend retired in 2019 after playing in the NBA for several years and is considered to be one of the most talented and popular players in the world.Also Read: “The toll that it takes on your marriage”: Dwayne Wade's wife Gabrielle Union reflects on the emotional impact of the NBA star's cancer diagnosis on their relationship
Article Summary: Dwayne Wade's wife, Gabrielle Union, reveals she thought of the worst outcome when the NBA legend was diagnosed with cancer. The NBA legend had to undergo surgery and remove a significant portion of one of his kidneys. He is currently healthy and is spreading awareness among his fans about his diagnosis and treatment.

Baltimore Ravens ’ star running back Derrick Henry has officially sold his Dallas home, but it’s not just a routine real estate transaction—it’s a symbolic farewell to a long-standing dream. Henry, who was once rumored to be eyeing a future with the Dallas Cowboys , sold the property for $1.6 million, falling short of its original asking price. This move marks the final chapter in his connection to Dallas, a city he once hoped to call his permanent NFL home.Henry originally bought the luxurious 4,154-square-foot home in Inwood Park in 2022. Featuring 20-foot ceilings, floor-to-ceiling windows, marble floors, and hardwood flooring, the property was a high-end investment. The stunning residence offers four bedrooms, four bathrooms, and a spacious three-car garage. Designed for both comfort and style, it boasts a gourmet kitchen, a cozy fireplace, custom walk-in closets, and a lush turf backyard perfect for outdoor relaxation.He first listed it for $1.8 million in 2023 but later took it off the market before relisting it at $1.6 million with a different real estate agency.According to TMZ, the final sale amount has not been disclosed, but sources suggest it was close to the lowered asking price. The sale ends Henry’s residential ties to Dallas, a city he had considered home due to his girlfriend, Adrianna Rivas , having family in the area.While Henry’s Dallas residency was partly personal, it was also fueled by his football aspirations. The running back admitted onpodcast that he had wanted to play for the Cowboys.” Henry said. “Unfortunately for Henry, the Cowboys never approached him.he revealed, making it clear that the interest was one-sided.Many Cowboys fans were thrilled by the idea of Derrick Henry joining the team and teaming up with Dak Prescott. With his powerful running style and Dallas’ solid offensive line, Henry could have brought a whole new level of strength to the offense. His ability to break tackles and wear down defenses seemed like the perfect fit for a team looking to boost its rushing attack. But despite all the excitement and speculation, the Cowboys stuck to their usual cautious approach to building the roster. Instead of making a big move for Henry, they decided to stay the course—meaning the star running back never got the call.Now, he’s set to be a major weapon for the Ravens, forming a lethal ground with his peers. While Cowboys fans may be left wondering what could have been, Ravens fans have every reason to celebrate. Henry isn’t just physically relocating—he’s mentally locked into Baltimore’s Super Bowl aspirations.Also read - Cam Heyward says he "Stole" DK Metcalf from the Chargers, did he cross the line?

Article Title: “Don't bring politicians on the ice”: Ex-NHL star Ryan Whitney criticizes PM Mark Carney's presence in Edmonton Oilers' pre-game skate
Article Text:

Ryan Whitney questions the timing of PM Mark Carney’s appearance



Connor McDavid welcomes PM Mark Carney's support



Polarized opinions about political personalities in sports



Former NHL defenseman Ryan Whitney had no qualms expressing his outrage about Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney attending the Edmonton Oilers ' pre-game skate. Whitney, a straight-talker, was taken aback at seeing a politician taking to the ice before an important game and wondered at the wisdom behind it and its effects on the preparation of the players.Showing disbelief at the timing of the visit, Ryan Whitney contended that pre-game skates are essential for the players to get their minds together and prepare. The ex-Edmonton Oilers blueliner noted that politicians should not attend during such times, especially when they are not skilled on ice skates.“This Carney guy, Mark Carney is his name. This guy is out there in a pregame skate… I don't care which way he leans politically. It could be the right-wing guy or the left-wing guy. You don't have a politician on the ice during the pregame skate , not to mention a politician who can't skate,” Whitney ranted. “Don't bring politicians on the ice, let alone on a practice day. We're talking pregame skate. Do you think Ryan Nugent-Hopkins wants some politician standing next to him before a game? You have your preparations.”Whitney's comments quickly resonated with hockey fans , with some thinking that politicians shouldn't interrupt game-day rituals, while others didn't see anything wrong with the visit.Even though Whitney panned the visit, Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid had another take. The superstar forward welcomed Mark Carney's visit, saying it was great to have a lifelong Oilers fan present around the team.“Obviously, it’s nice to have him here. He's an Oilers fan, a lifelong Oilers fan. Oilers fans are welcome here, for sure. I don't know if his security detail would appreciate that too much. But, of course, it's a special thing to bring him here. It was great to meet him,” McDavid said.Mark Carney's ice appearance has ignited controversy, with some regarding it as a friendly gesture and others, such as Ryan Whitney, thinking that it breaks up the team's routine. Support from celebrity figures is welcome to fans, but whether it should only be in the form of off-ice engagement is questionable.Also read: “Nice to have him here”: Connor McDavid on Canada PM Mark Carney's appearance at Oilers morning skate While the Edmonton Oilers' season goes on, the players and their game will continue to be the priority, but the words of Whitney have made sure that Mark Carney's visit will not soon be forgotten.

Whitney said politicians should not attend during such times, especially when they are not skilled on ice skates. Connor McDavid welcomed Carney's visit, saying it was great to have a lifelong Oilers fan present.

Article Title: Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce couldn’t stop laughing at Jayson Tatum’s honest reaction to his nickname ‘The Anomaly’
Article Text:
Jayson Tatum and Travis Kelce. Image via: Mitchell Leff/ Getty Images | New Heights Podcast (screengrab)

Jayson Tatum reacted to his nickname ‘The Anomaly’ while speaking with Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce



Where did Jayson Tatum’s nickname come from?



Boston Celtics star Jayson Tatum ’s reaction to a particular nickname has sparked plenty of discussion among fans and media alike. Tatum, who has been a star player for the Celtics, recently addressed the growing trend of people calling him ‘ The Anomaly ’ during his chat with NFL star siblings Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce in a new episode a their New Heights podcast .During a guest appearance on the New Heights podcast hosted by NFL stars Travis and Jason Kelce, Jayson Tatum was asked about the nickname that has been making rounds on social media. Travis Kelce, referring to Tatum’s Wikipedia page, brought up the moniker and asked, “Has anybody that is close to you ever actually called you, ‘The Anomaly’?”Tatum was amused. He responded with a candid answer that sent the Kelce brothers into fits of laughter. “Twitter is not a real place, I’ll say that,” Tatum hared. His reaction made it clear that he wasn’t exactly embracing the nickname, despite its growing popularity.Jason Kelce, however, had a different take. “I would run with that one. I like it. ‘The Anomaly’ is a good one. I don’t know who came up with that.” To which Travis Kelce agreed, saying, “It is a banger.”The origins of ‘The Anomaly’ trace back to social media, where an X user first suggested it, pointing out Tatum’s unique skill set. “Handles like someone 6 inches shorter, shoots pull-ups like a guard, finishes at the rim like a center, and consistently defends 1-5.”The nickname got wide attention, and soon, even official team accounts like the Portland Trail Blazers started using it in their game promotions. Basketball Reference has even added it to Tatum’s list of nicknames.Previously, when asked directly if he liked the name, he hesitated before admitting, “Ahhh, I don’t know.” He went on to mention that friends and teammates call him by other names, such as ‘Big Deuce’ and ‘Taco.’Also Read: Jayson Tatum's injury report (March 26, 2025): Is the Boston Celtics star fit to play against the Phoenix Suns tonight? Regardless of whether ‘The Anomaly’ nickname sticks, there’s no denying that Tatum’s game lives up to the title. At 6’10”, his mobility, ball-handling, and scoring ability make him one of the most versatile players in the NBA. He has been a standout star for the Celtics and is arguably one of the most complete players in the league today.
Article Summary: Boston Celtics star Jayson Tatum was a guest on the New Heights podcast. He was asked about his nickname 'The Anomaly' and his reaction. Tatum responded by saying, "Twitter is not a real place, I’ll say that"

Article Title: Why did Hulk Hogan and Linda Hogan divorce? The shocking truth behind their controversial marriage

Keeping Up With The Kardashians

83 Weeks

It wasn’t just a celebrity divorce. It was a full-blown public implosion — with affairs, physical abuse claims, secret lawsuits, millions at stake, and kids stuck in the middle. Hulk Hogan (real name: Terry Bollea ) and Linda Hogan were married for 24 years. But the moment it ended, it dragged the entire Hogan brand down with it. And even now, nearly two decades later, it’s still messy.This wasn’t about two people growing apart. It was about betrayal. Control. Damage. And the fallout that never stopped.Linda Hogan says the final straw came when she found out Hulk Hogan had been sleeping with Christiane Plante — a friend of their daughter, Brooke Hogan.This wasn’t a rumor. Plante herself admitted it in a 2008 interview with theAnd she knew what it cost her.Linda Hogan’s publicist backed it all up in, saying:Hulk Hogan denied the affair in his memoir. Denied all infidelity, in fact. Said Linda Hogan just got suspicious whenever he spoke to a woman. But by the time this went public, the damage was already done — to their family, to Brooke Hogan, to their entire reputation.And yes, Brooke Hogan was shattered. She posted this on MySpace — and then deleted it:Linda Hogan didn't stop at cheating accusations. She later said Hulk Hogan was emotionally abusive — and physically terrifying behind closed doors.In her memoir, she claimed:She went on, saying she couldn’t rebuild her life even after the divorce:She blamed Hulk Hogan for destroying the future they planned — the holidays, the weddings, even their relationships with their kids. Linda said she lost her trust, her love, her home. And that the trauma didn’t just fade after the cameras were gone.On the surface, “Hogan Knows Best” made the Hogan family look tight. It aired on VH1 from 2005 to 2007. It was early reality TV — the kind that walked socould run.But the truth was messier. Hulk Hogan’s marriage was falling apart in real time, and the show tried to paint over it with forced smiles and edited footage. It worked for a while — the ratings were strong — but inside that house, things were breaking.Eric Bischoff confirmed this years later on hispodcast, pointing to Hulk Hogan’s own memoir.The show didn’t cause the split. But it poured gasoline on everything that was already burning.Linda Hogan filed for divorce in 2007. Hulk Hogan didn’t even know. A reporter told him during a phone interview. He hung up. Called back five minutes later.By 2009, it was finalized. Linda walked away with 70% of their liquid assets, 40% ownership of Hulk Hogan’s companies, and a $3 million property settlement.But the fighting didn’t end. Linda Hogan dated a 19-year-old named Charlie Hill (a kid who went to school with Brooke Hogan). He sued her for $1.5 million claiming she made him do unpaid yard work. Hulk Hogan got remarried — twice. His second marriage to Jennifer McDaniel ended after a sex tape scandal. His third marriage, to Sky Daily, happened in 2023. Bruce Brown led the Pelicans with 18 points, while rookie center Yves Missi recorded his 12th double-double, finishing with 12 points and 10 rebounds.The Pelicans had an early advantage, but they couldn’t keep up with Golden State’s second-half surge. The Golden State remains in seventh place in the West and is focused on climbing into the top six to avoid the play-in tournament. Article Text:

MUMBAI: It’s a story of perseverance. The night of November 25, 2024, was a painful one for Shardul Thakur . Much to everyone’s surprise, the ‘Palghar Express,’ who had played 83 internationals for India, went unsold in the Indian Premier League auction. Just days before that, the 33-year-old had been left out of India’s squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy to be played in Australia. For Thakur, it was a particularly bitter pill to swallow, given his big role in India’s historic win at the Gabba in 2021.Thakur had played a match-winning knock of 67 and taken a seven-wicket haul (7/69). However, at the pre-tour press conference, India’s head coach Gautam Gambhir signalled a shift toward younger players, stating that all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy represented India’s future. The statement effectively ended Thakur’s Test career.Refusing to be discouraged, Thakur, who had recently recovered from ankle surgery, bounced back spectacularly in the Ranji Trophy, finishing the season with 35 wickets in nine matches at 22.62 and scoring 505 runs at 42.08, including a century and four fifties.With the IPL seemingly out of reach, Thakur signed up with English county side Essex for the summer, hoping the experience would aid his chances ahead of India’s upcoming England tour."He's not someone who sulks at home. He knew county cricket would help him if he got picked for the England tour. He’s been working hard on his game and fitness," said childhood coach Dinesh Lad.Then came the twist of fate.A call from Zaheer Khan, the mentor of Lucknow Super Giants, changed everything. With LSG’s left-arm pacer Mohsin Khan ruled out due to injury, Thakur was signed at his base price of Rs 2 crore. What has followed is nothing short of remarkable.Thakur, who wasn’t even in the IPL a week earlier, is now the tournament’s second-highest wicket-taker with six wickets in two matches."Zaheer called me when I was playing Ranji and he said, 'You may be called in as a potential replacement, so don’t switch off'," Thakur said after his 4/34 on Thursday against SRH on a flat pitch, an effort which followed his 2/19 in two overs against Delhi Capitals."He has bowled superbly whenever he has come on. I was shocked that he only bowled two overs in the first match. He took two wickets in those two overs," Lad said.Few have seen Thakur’s struggles as closely as his wife, Mittali Parulkar, who has been part of his journey since they tied the knot on February 27, 2024."When he wasn't picked at the IPL auction, he was disheartened for a day or two, but then he moved on. Just before that, he wasn’t picked for Australia, and he was already dealing with recovery from surgery. But he took it in his stride," Parulkar told TOI.
Article Summary: Shardul Thakur was left out of India's squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy in Australia. The 33-year-old had played a big role in India's historic win at the Gabba in 2021. The 'Palghar Express' went unsold in the Indian Premier League auction. He signed up with English county side Essex for the summer.

Article Title: 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli's in, but who's out? Selection dilemma as India look to seal series against England
Article Text:
Virat Kohli during a practice session. (PTI Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

'It’s a slightly two-paced pitch': Harshit Rana after claiming three-wicket haul on ODI debut

CUTTACK: One look at the stands on Saturday evening at the Barabati Stadium , and one could have been forgiven for mistaking it for match day instead of match eve.The Odisha Cricket Association 's (OCA) decision to open part of the stands for fans to watch India train, for free, ahead of the crucial second ODI against England here was a hit, with the stadium nearly half full.The loudest cheers from the 20,000-plus crowd were reserved for the man who missed the first ODI in Nagpur with a sore right knee — Virat Kohli Saturday's nets, however, suggested Kohli was not going to sit out another game. One of the fittest cricketers around, the former India captain last missed a match — before the Nagpur ODI — more than three years ago, the Johannesburg Test against South Africa in Jan 2022. Fit and raring to go, the star batter was the first to hit the nets and batted for nearly an hour before leaving the ground first, shouldering his cricket coffin.While England completely skipped Saturday's practice, many India players also skipped the optional session, including last-match hero Shreyas Iyer , vice-captain Shubman Gill , debutant Harshit Rana, comeback man Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Axar Patel."Virat Kohli is fit to play. He has come for practice and is good to go," batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said during the prematch media interaction.With a fit-again Kohli back in the playing XI, India will face a selection dilemma as they prepare to tick all the boxes ahead of the Champions Trophy and seal the series before going to Ahmedabad.Will Iyer lose his place to Kohli if the team management decides to continue with Yashasvi Jaiswal to keep the left-right opening combination going with captain Rohit Sharma ? Kotak, however, bypassed any queries on who should make way for Kohli on Sunday."I think that's what the head coach and captain can talk about. But yes, definitely a lefty-righty combination is there. But I would say that question is not something which I would like to answer, to be very honest," was Kotak's diplomatic answer.Rohit's form will certainly also be a concern for the side, no matter how the management tries to brush aside any doubts regarding his continuous run of poor form. Rohit, incidentally, got out after scoring only two runs in the first ODI of this series.Rohit coming back into form will certainly be a big boost for the hosts ahead of the ICC event starting on Feb 19. The track looks a belter and could well be the right platform for the ‘Hitman' to get some much-needed runs under his belt.Meanwhile, KL Rahul is likely to get another look-in as the wicketkeeper-batter ahead of Rishabh Pant, who batted for long in the nets. However, left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh bowled long spells during the practice session and could replace Shami, who might be rested to manage his workload following a long injury layoff.Although dew factor is unlikely to come into play here, batting second will be the preferred choice, as chasing teams have won 12 out of the 19 ODIs played here over the years.

The loudest cheers from the 20,000-plus crowd were reserved for the man who missed the first ODI in Nagpur with a sore right knee. England completely skipped Saturday's practice, but many India players also skipped the optional session.

Article Title: Who won yesterday's IPL match, SRH vs LSG: Yesterday IPL match result
Article Text:
Lucknow Super Giants' Nicholas Pooran, left, celebrates his half century with Mitchell Marsh (PTI Photo)

NEW DELHI: In a thrilling IPL encounter, Shardul Thakur 's impressive four-wicket haul and Nicholas Pooran 's sensational display of power-hitting guided Lucknow Super Giants ( LSG ) to a five-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) on Thursday.Thakur's dream comeback continued as he returned with figures of 4/34, helping LSG restrict the formidable SRH batting lineup to 190/9.Pooran then took center stage, showcasing his 360-degree hitting prowess with a blistering 70 off just 26 deliveries, including six fours and six maximums. His partnership with Mitchell Marsh (52 off 31) yielded a match-winning 116 runs for the second wicket, propelling LSG to chase down the target in just 16.1 overs.Despite losing Aiden Markram early in their chase, LSG surged ahead thanks to the effortless hitting from Marsh and Pooran. Pooran, in particular, was at his attacking best, dealing primarily in sixes and clobbering Simarjeet and Abhishek Sharma for massive hits, mostly towards the square boundary.SRH found it challenging to contain Pooran as he didn't even spare Cummins, hitting him for two fours in his first over to reach 77/1 in the powerplay. Pooran brought up the fastest fifty of the season in just 18 balls with another colossal six over square leg off Adam Zampa's bowling.Cummins eventually trapped Pooran in front of the wickets in the ninth over, but Marsh took the onus upon himself and brought up his half-century off just 29 balls. Although LSG skipper Rishabh Pant (15 off 15) couldn't contribute much, Abdul Samad played an entertaining cameo to guide his side home.Earlier, after opting to bowl first, Shardul (4/34) provided LSG with a fiery start, removing Abishek Sharma and the previous match's centurion, Ishan Kishan, in consecutive balls in the third over. While Shardul sent Sharma packing with a short delivery, he dismissed Kishan caught behind off an innocuous delivery down the leg side.Travis Head (47 off 28), however, looked in ominous form as he took the attack to the opposition, using his brute power to deal in boundaries and sixes. Head was particularly brutal against Avesh Khan, hitting him for two sixes and one four to pick up 18 runs in the fourth over.Head was fortunate to receive two reprieves, but his luck eventually ran out when fast bowler Prince Yadav disturbed his timbers to claim his first IPL wicket.Henrich Klaasen (26 off 17) was run out in a bizarre fashion by Yadav off his own bowling, while young Aniket Verma played a 13-ball 36-run cameo that included five sixes before falling to leg-spinner Disvesh Rathi.SRH skipper Pat Cummins (18 off 4) hit three sixes off his first three balls before departing in style, contributing to SRH's competitive total of 190/9.
Article Summary: Lucknow Super Giants ( LSG) beat Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets. Shardul Thakur (4/34) and Nicholas Pooran (70) guided LSG to victory. LSG chased down the target of 190 in 16.1 overs.

GUWAHATI: With the current Indian Premier League (IPL) season witness to some high-scoring games in the opening week, Wednesday’s match at the ACA Stadium then looked like an aberration.The Barsapara track offered help for the tweakers as Kolkata Knight Riders spinners, Varun Chakravarthy and Moeen Ali , ran through hosts Rajasthan Royals’ middle order to choke the flow of runs to restrict them to 151.On the wicket, Ali said, “It was good one, had a bit of everything — swing, bit of seam, spun nicely but not massively, just enough spin. The English allrounder had praise for his ‘mystery’ partner Chakravarthy.“I came on before him (seventh over), so my job was to bowl tight. I’m used to bowling with somebody who’s better and has more mystery. So I bowl as tight as I can and hopefully, that builds pressure for them to get wickets,” Ali said.“Varun’s a brilliant bowler who has improved so much over the last two-three years. It’s amazing to bowl with him.”

After serving a one-match suspension for an over-rate offence from Mumbai Indians ' (MI) concluding match of the 2024 Indian Premier League season, Hardik Pandya will be back to lead the five-time champions in their second match of this edition against Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad on Saturday.Both MI and the 2022 champions Gujarat had lost their opening fixtures against Chennai Super Kings and Punjab Kings, respectively and are keen to put a win on the board for their first points.The MI squad utilised the extended break between their first and second matches by spending time at the Reliance facility in Jamnagar, where they participated in team-building exercises and relaxation activities.While the return of captain and all-rounder Hardik will come as a boost for MI, they will remain without the services of their premier fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, who continues to recuperate from his back injury at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence on Bengaluru.Hardik's return to the playing eleven likely means Robin Minz's exclusion, although MI's batting performance on the tricky Chepauk pitch failed to generate confidence.The batting conditions in Ahmedabad on Saturday evening will prove more favourable, considering the substantial 475 runs scored in 40 overs during the first match of the season at the venue between Punjab Kings (243) and hosts Gujarat (232).But the batting-friendly surface at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad raises concerns about Mohammed Siraj's effectiveness, following his expensive spell of 54 runs in the previous match where Punjab batters dominated his bowling.With not many senior Indian pacers in the GT ranks, it will be a strategic call that home team head coach Ashish Nehra will fret upon. The pressure to contain runs as well as take wickets is way too much on Kagiso Rabada and Rashid Khan.Both the teams clearly had difficulties in finding the optimal blend of their overseas players.For MI, the challenges are further intensified due to Suryakumar Yadav's prolonged dip in performance over the past year, while Rohit Sharma also needs to rediscover his consistency.The addition of Pandya strengthens the batting lineup while offering bowling options, particularly at the start of the innings. His expertise in delivering wide yorkers during death overs.The Gujarat Titans' overall performance this season could heavily depend on captain Shubman Gill's batting form.The bowling department presents concerns for captain Gill, as the Indian pacers - Siraj, Prasidh Krishna and Ishant Sharma - predominantly employ similar hit-the-deck techniques. Apart from Rabada, the pace attack lacks variety in their bowling arsenal.

NEW DELHI: World under-23 champion Reetika Hooda relinquished a substantial advantage in the final against Kyrgyzstan’s Aiperi Medet Kyzy to settle for a silver medal in the Asian wrestling championships in Amman, Jordan.Reetika looked poised for a convincing victory leading 6-2 in her women’s freestyle 76kg championship match against Aiperi, but yielded four points in the final 10 seconds and finished second. The Kyrgyz opponent had defeated the Indian in the quarterfinals of the Paris Olympics last year.Earlier, Reetika had defeated South Korean Seoyeon Jeong 3-0 in the quarters and then accounted for Japan’s Nodoka Yamamoto by a 10-0 scoreline, securing a victory by fall in the semis.Her teammates, Mansi Lather and Muskan , added to the country’s medal tally by winning a bronze each.Mansi secured her first senior international medal after winning bronze in the 68kg division, following her triumph over Kazakhstan’s Irina Kazyulina 12-2 via technical superiority.Mansi, a World under-17 champion, was awarded a victory by forfeit in her quarters when world 72kg champion and tournament favourite, Japan’s Ami Ishii, withdrew due to an injury.Muskan (59kg) comfortably defeated Philippines’ Arian G Carpio in her qualification bout but lost her quarterfinal to Japan’s Sakura Onishi. Up against Mongolia’s Altjin Togtokh in the bronze playoff, Muskan gradually got a grip over the contest by sealing it 4-0.Earlier, India concluded its campaign in the Greco-Roman division with two medals. Nitesh won the bronze on Thursday, following Sunil Kumar’s third-place finish in the continental meet. It was Nitesh’s first senior medal at the Asian level.
Article Summary: World under-23 champion Reetika Hooda relinquished a substantial advantage in the final against Kyrgyzstan’s Aiperi Medet Kyzy to settle for a silver medal in the Asian wrestling championships in Amman, Jordan. Her teammates Mansi Lather and Muskan added to the country's medal tally by winning a bronze each. Earlier, India concluded its campaign in the Greco-Roman division with two medals.

Article Title: A win 17 years in the making for RCB!
Article Text:

CHENNAI: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have broken the Chepauk jinx, and how! When they last beat mighty neighbours Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at the MA Chidambaram Stadium, Rahul Dravid was still their captain. The only RCB player who was part of that 2008 squad and is still playing is Virat Kohli , and his face at the end of the 50-run rout said it all.At the other end of the spectrum were the shocked faces of those 34,000-odd CSK diehards, who are not exactly used to a humiliation of this magnitude in their own den. To add salt to CSK’s wounds, RCB had a forward short-leg and a slip in place in the 16th over when MS Dhoni finally came out to bat at No. 9.So many things must have felt so different for all those who have been turning up regularly at the Chepauk over the last 17 years. Adding to the list of ‘new’ was the ‘method’ in the RCB approach that had been missing from their game for so long.For years, an element of mindlessness had characterized their game, but on Friday night the RCB batters stuck to a plan and didn’t lose their heads.In a chase of 197, CSK lost two quick wickets to Josh Hazlewood early on and from there on, severely lacked the firepower to make a match of it. There was zero intent in the CSK approach and the defeat is an early reminder for them that old-school T20 cricket that they are still trying to recreate might have passed its sell-by date.This was their biggest-ever defeat at home. Before all that, RCB’s batters gave their bowlers a sound platform.With a batting lineup as deep as theirs, where Tim David comes at No. 7, the plan was to have at least one Indian batter who is good at playing spin at one end throughout the innings. While it was Virat Kohli (31 off 30 balls) in the beginning with Phil Salt (32 off 16) doing the heavy lifting, the back-end was left to skipper Rajat Patidar Given a life early on when Deepak Hooda dropped him at long-off, Patidar (51 off 32 balls) showed why he is so highly rated. There’s a natural elegance about his game. The right-hander plays spin with ease and there’s an ability to generate power.All these attributes were on display against a CSK attack that could have easily restricted a lesser batting lineup, but Patidar ensured that didn’t happen.
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) beat Chennai Super Kings (CSK) by 50 runs. RCB last beat CSK at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in 2008. Rajat Patidar top scored for RCB with 51 off 32 balls.
